title: Enterprise Delivery Management System
challenge: The CISCO team, ranging from project administrators, team managers and engineers, were struggling with the outdated interface causing workflow inefficiencies and navigation confusion across complex project hierarchies
role: Lead UI/UX Designer and Frontend Developer
technologies: Angular, C#, HTML/CSS, Git, Adobe XD

bullets: Significantly improved usability and workflow efficiency
Streamlined user access to core functionalities
Best version the client has ever had across all 10 versions

solutions.title: Rebrand, UI & Navigation Overhaul
solutions.problem: Horizontal menu overflow, disjointed user flows. Outdated branding and system looks dated.
solutions.solution: Vertical collapsible navigation with role-based grouping. Mapped user role flows. Updated branding and modernized UI design.
solutionbullets: Mapped user flows to identify friction points
Rebranded and modernized UI design for improved aesthetics and usability
Redesigned Menu structure based on user roles and tasks
Collapsible vertical menu, with role-based grouping
impactbullets: The redesigned system achieved the tender shortlist status!
Client stated 'the best look InSpec has ever had' - the first across all previous 10 versions that they didn't want to rollback for ease and comfort of use.
Project managers had quick and easy access to their core functionalities without getting lost while the Engineers could get straight to their tasks.

solutions.title: Treeview Intelligence
solutions.problem: Users making blind clicks to discover node contents, wasting time and causing frustration.
solutions.solution: Visual indicators for treeview child nodes, additional contents, inline actions leading to smarter decisions. Add option to view tasks as treeview, kanban or listing with drag-n-drop functionality.
solutionbullets: Added inline visual indicators for child nodes, and inline 'hasFlags' indicators for issues, reminders, documents and attachments
Inline actions for quick access to common node-specific tasks
Smarter expansion based on inline indicator visuals
Toggle task overview between treeview, listing and kanban board for familiar task management
impactbullets: System was easier to use with at-a-glance indicators, highlighting additional content
Significantly reduced user frustration from unnecessary node clicks, to finding out if a node had children, issues, reminders, documents and attachments.
Greater user satisfaction with multiple task overview display options: treeview, kanban board and listing (My Tasks) with drag-n-drop functionality to shift items up or down.

gallery.caption: AFTER - Visual indicators for child nodes, issues, reminders, documents and attachments in the Project Treeview.

BEFORE - Old PMO Projects Treeview showing an opened Task with no subtask, along with other unopened Milestones - with no idea if they have child nodes (tasks, subtasks) or Issues, Reminders, Documents and Attachments, leading to empty clicks and significant frustration.
